oai_dc:dc.dc:title: List of Confederate quartermaster's stores
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Confederate States of America -- Quartermaster General's Office
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: List of quartermaster's stores received by Quartermaster to Captain J. P. Baltzell, Provost Marshall at Augusta, Georgia. List includes two horses, one mule, three saddles, and three bridles taken from R. N. H. Mazer of Company D, 3rd South Carolina Cavalry, Private W. S. Morgan of Company H, 11th Georgia Cavalary, and Private J. English Company D, 3rd Georgia Cavalry. All were taken from "men straggling from Gen. Wheeler's Command."
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Confederate States of America -- Quartermaster General's Office
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Quartermaster of the Army provides logistical support to the combat troops in the form of ammunition, clothing, food, and pay. The provost marshal commands the military police. "Gen. Wheeler" was General Joseph Wheeler, Confederate General from Augusta, Georgia.
